page.title: 01HOT ROCKS NEAR FALMOUTH
page.content: This area is dominated by extractive industries. Numerous small quarries produce good quality Cornish granite which is used for building and headstones. Most quarries are quite small but several are large (a few are abandoned workings). In the middle of the area is a research site called Rosemanowen which is a geothermal energy project. It is run by the world famous Camborne School of Mines. It is an exciting experiment to obtain energy from colling the very hot water found between the granite far underground. The project has grants from the Department of Energy and the E.E.C. The rest of the area is very barren. The ground lies mainly between 150-190 metres above sea level which gives panoramic views. Most of the land lies under rough pastures with a few scattered hamlets. The majority
